bibl.title: Letter from R. G. Bradshaw to Philip Showalter Hench, November 5, 1947

div1.p: Bradshaw provides details concerning Hench's upcoming lecture at the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from R. G. Bradshaw to Philip Showalter Hench, November 5, 1947
div1.opener:
Department of Medicine
University of Virginia
Charlottesville, Virginia
November 5, 1947
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
102-110 Second Ave. S.W.
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
The Society was indeed delighted to receive your
recent letter and to know that you will be here to present
the principal address at our coming Alpha Omega Alpha
initiation.

Now to give you the information that you requested.
The address is now scheduled for 4:30 P.M. in the Medical
School Amphitheater. Provisions will be made to show your
lantern slides. Following the address there will be an
initiation ceremony of approximately 30 minutes duration.
The entire Society will then go to the Monticello Hotel
for the banquet which is to begin at approximately 7:00
P.M.. Thus, there will be ample time for a full hour address
or longer if you so desire. Dress for both the initiation
and the banquet is informal. It is quite agreeable with
the Society for you to plan to leave on the 10:57 train.
The University of Virginia Chapter of the Alpha Omega Alpha
was founded in 1919.
We are looking forward to your address on November 17.

closer.signed:
R. G. Bradshaw
Secretary, Virginia Alpha Chapter
Alpha Omega Alpha
